chefs.name: Alice Smith
chefs.bio: Alice Smith is a Mexican chef who specializes in traditional Mexican cuisine. She has worked in various restaurants and catering companies over the years, perfecting her craft and developing her own unique style. Her dishes are known for their bold flavors and use of fresh, locally-sourced ingredients.

recipes.name: Chiles Rellenos
method: 1. Preheat broiler. Place poblanos on a baking sheet and broil until blackened, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and place in a plastic bag for 10 minutes to steam. Remove skins and seeds from peppers.
2. In a large skillet, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic until beef is browned. Stir in rice and cheese. Stuff each pepper with beef mixture.

3. In a shallow dish, whisk together flour and eggs. Dip each stuffed pepper in egg mixture to coat. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Fry peppers until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
4. In a saucepan, heat tomato sauce, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Pour over peppers and serve hot.

recipes.name: Taco Salad
method: 1. In a large skillet, cook ground beef and taco seasoning until beef is browned. Drain excess fat.
2. In a large bowl, combine lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese, sour cream, and salsa. Add beef and mix well.
3. Serve in individual bowls and top with crushed tortilla chips.

recipes.name: Chicken Enchiladas
method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Add tomatoes, chicken, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
2. In a separate bowl, combine cheese and sour cream. Spoon chicken mixture onto each tortilla and roll up. Place enchiladas in a baking dish.
3. Pour chicken broth over enchiladas and top with cheese mixture. Bake for 20

chefs.name: Bob Johnson
chefs.bio: Bob Johnson is a Mexican-American chef who grew up in a family of restaurateurs. He learned to cook from his parents and has since honed his skills by working in top restaurants around the world. His dishes are a fusion of Mexican and international flavors, and are always creative and exciting.

recipes.name: Sopa de Fideo
ingredients: 4 oz vermicelli, broken into small pieces
Lime wedges and chopped cilantro, for serving
method: 1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add vermicelli and cook until golden brown, stirring frequently.
2. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent.
3. Add tomatoes, chicken broth, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
4. Serve hot with lime wedges and chopped cilantro on top.

recipes.name: Ensalada de Nopalitos
method: 1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add nopales and boil for 5 minutes.
2. Drain nopales and rinse under cold water. Pat dry with paper towels.
3. In a large bowl, combine nopales, onion, tomato, and cilantro.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour over nopales mixture and toss to coat.
5. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Pico de Gallo
method: 1. In a medium bowl, combine tomatoes, onion, jalapeño pepper, and cilantro.
2. Add lime juice and salt to taste. Stir well.
3. Serve chilled with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos, burritos, or grilled meats.

chefs.name: Charlie Brown
chefs.bio: Charlie Brown is a renowned Mexican chef who has been in the industry for over 15 years. He is a master of traditional Mexican cuisine, and is known for his expertise in creating complex dishes with simple, authentic ingredients. He has won numerous awards for his culinary skills and is highly respected in the industry.

recipes.name: Cochinita Pibil
method: 1. Preheat oven to 325°F.
2. In a large bowl, combine orange juice, lime juice, vinegar, achiote paste, cumin, oregano, garlic, and salt. Mix well.
3. Add beef shoulder to the bowl and coat it with the marinade.
4. Place the beef and the marinade in a large baking dish. Top with sliced onion and habanero pepper.
5. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 4 hours, or until the beef is tender and falls apart.
6. Serve the beef with fresh cilantro and tortillas.

recipes.name: Tinga de Pollo
ingredients: 2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, chopped
method: 1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent.
2. Add chicken thighs to the pot and cook until browned on all sides.
3. Add diced tomatoes, chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stir well.
4. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and tender.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and tortillas.

recipes.name: Arroz con Leche
method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Add tomatoes, chicken, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
2. In a separate bowl, combine cheese and sour cream. Spoon chicken mixture onto each tortilla and roll up. Place enchiladas in a baking dish.
3. Pour chicken broth over enchiladas and top with cheese mixture. Bake for 20

chefs.name: Dan Martinez
chefs.bio: Dan Martinez is a Mexican chef who has a passion for using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients in his dishes. He has worked in restaurants across Mexico, and is known for his inventive and creative approach to traditional Mexican cuisine. His dishes are always colorful, flavorful, and beautifully presented.

recipes.name: Enchiladas Suizas
method: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
2. In a medium saucepan, heat tomatillo salsa over low heat. Add sour cream and stir until combined.
3. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add tortillas, one at a time, and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 15 seconds per side. Drain on paper towels.
4. Spread 1/2 cup of the tomatillo sauce mixture in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Tacos al Pastor
method: 1. In a large bowl, combine pineapple juice, vinegar, achiote paste, garlic, oregano, cumin, salt, and cinnamon. Mix well.
2. Add beef slices to the bowl and coat them with the marinade.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
4. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
5. Thread beef slices onto skewers and grill for 2-3 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through.
6. Serve the beef on corn tortillas with diced onion, chopped cilantro, and sliced lime.
7. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Sopa de Fideo
method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Add tomatoes, chicken, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
2. In a separate bowl, combine cheese and sour cream. Spoon chicken mixture onto each tortilla and roll up. Place enchiladas in a baking dish.
3. Pour chicken broth over enchiladas and top with cheese mixture. Bake for 20

chefs.name: Eduardo Gonzalez
chefs.bio: Eduardo Gonzalez is a Mexican chef who has been in the industry for over 20 years. He has worked in some of the best restaurants in Mexico, and is known for his expertise in creating dishes that highlight the flavors of different regions of the country. His dishes are always beautifully crafted and perfectly balanced.

recipes.name: Pico de Gallo
method: 1. In a medium bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, onion, jalapeño pepper, and cilantro.
2. Squeeze the lime juice over the mixture and stir to combine.
3. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
4. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
5. Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos, burritos, or grilled meats.
6. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Tamales de Elote
method: 1. Soak corn husks in warm water for 30 minutes.
2. In a blender or food processor, puree corn kernels until smooth.
3. In a large bowl, cream the vegetable shortening and sugar together until light and fluffy.
4. Add the corn puree, baking powder, salt, masa harina, and warm water to the bowl. Mix well.
5. Drain the corn husks and pat dry with paper towels.
6. Spread a heaping tablespoon of the corn mixture onto the center of each husk.
7. Serve hot with salsa and sour cream, if desired.
8. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Sopes
method: 1. In a large bowl, combine masa harina and salt. Gradually stir in warm water to form a dough.
2. Divide the dough into 12 equal pieces and roll each piece
3. Pour chicken broth over enchiladas and top with cheese mixture. Bake for 20

chefs.name: Fernanda Rodriguez
chefs.bio: Fernanda Rodriguez is a young and talented Mexican chef who has quickly made a name for herself in the industry. She has a passion for experimenting with different flavors and ingredients, and her dishes are always surprising and delicious. She is a rising star in the Mexican culinary scene.

recipes.name: Enchiladas Verdes
method: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
2. In a skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.
3. Add the shredded chicken, cumin, salt, pepper, and cilantro. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. In a separate pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil. Add the tomatillos, serrano peppers, onion, garlic, cilantro, salt, and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes, until the tomatillos are soft.

recipes.name: Pozole Rojo
method: 1. In a large pot, combine the beef, water, onion, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 hours, until the beef is tender.
2. Add the hominy to the pot and continue to simmer for an additional 30 minutes.

3. While the pozole is simmering, prepare the chile sauce. In a separate pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil. Add the chiles, onion, garlic, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes, until the chiles are soft.

recipes.name: Chicken Enchiladas
method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large skillet, cook onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Add tomatoes, chicken, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
2. In a separate bowl, combine cheese and sour cream. Spoon chicken mixture onto each tortilla and roll up. Place enchiladas in a baking dish.
3. Pour chicken broth over enchiladas and top with cheese mixture. Bake for 20
